title: R SLF Development SOP
text: SOP aims provide background framework contributing SLF (Source Linkage Files) R project.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: piece work required logged issue GitHub. allows piece work assigned individual work . provides well-organised workflow team work collaboratively.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: Generally speaking, use GitHub Flow model R development, main-R branch base branch. master branch left untouched changes merged onto main-R branch.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: work new issue, need create new branch. best done even small changes renaming scripts/functions. , make sure main-R --date version. can done using RStudio buttons: switch branch (checkout) main-R pull, click new branch button left current branch name create new branch, name new branch something meaningful descriptive. , equally terminal: completed , can start use new branch. branch safe place make changes. make mistake, can revert changes push additional changes fix mistake. changes end default branch merge branch. one person charge/making changes branch.
code: git checkout main-R git pull git checkout -b <new_branch_name>

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: Commits contain changes carried script. can little often want. Ideally, commit contain isolated, complete change. makes easy revert changes needed. good working practice can committing completion script, end day working, requested changes script. commit changes, use commit button Git pane RStudio, give commit descriptive message help future contributors understand changes commit contains. See writing meaningfull commit messages -depth advice. committed changes, push branch using push button git push terminal.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: commit, absolutely push, make sure code documented, tested, checked styled. Document: Ctrl + Shift + D, ‘Document’ button ‘’ build pane, running devtools::document invoke {roxygen2} build documentation functions. Note GitHub action set-automatically perform step ’s missed. Test: Ctrl + Alt + F7, ‘Test Package’ button ‘’ build pane, running devtools::test invoke {testthat} run new existing tests written. Writing tests checking still working ensures functions supposed , highlight changes make inadvertantly break existing behaviour. Check: Ctrl + Shift + E, ‘Check’ button build pane, running devtools::check. can take couple minutes peforms lots checks, including steps document test. information steps performed see Automated checking chapter R Packages book. Style: Use {styler} style files ’ve created modified, ensures codebase consistent style. Note GitHub action set-automatically perform step ’s missed.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: pull request branch merged onto main-R thorough checks feedback. create pull request done GitHub Pull Request section team’s repository. tab, click ‘new pull request’. need enter branch merged . Make sure change base main-R master. compare select current branch. give pull request meaningful name description including information may help team understand/work script. Include link issue pull request closing entering Closes #<issuenumber>. -depth information pull requests can found . options can entered help categorise pull request, labels projects. Please enter keep repo good working order. Also, need select reviewer/s may . best way select team name ‘Reviewers’, randomly select members team fewer requests review. can also manually @mention request review specific people required double-checking assistance.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: reviewer/s leave questions, comments, suggestions. can comment whole pull request add comments specific lines. includes suggesting edits code. review completed, can go look comments suggestions left. pull request able merged changes complete. suggestions code left can committed GitHub selecting ‘commit suggestion’, make sure pull updated branch R test suggestions break code. can continue commit push changes response review pull request update automatically.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: Reviewing another branch conducted GitHub. notified asked review. review: R, switch review branch, run code contained scripts, make sure check scripts branch may require new functions run code work, outlined description pull request, check everything working expected, head back GitHub pull request, ‘files changed’ tab outlines scripts included branch. tab allows add comments/suggestions + clicking specific lines code, can dragged include large chunk code. just leaving comment can entered box pops + clicked. make suggestion code, click ± ‘add suggestion’ button, allows write code used instead.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: pull request approved, outstanding comments/suggestions, GitHub allow merge pull request. automatically merge branch changes now appear main-R. may result merge conflicts need resolved merging. best practice keep branch --date main-R throughout editing process. can done using git rebase. pull request approved, delete branch. indicates work branch complete prevents others accidentally using old branches. may done automatically GitHub.

title: R SLF Development SOP
text: work carried can done solely R GitHub underlying Git. Git commands can used Terminal using buttons push pull branch. cheat sheet can found can help need use .

what: Write an R rds file — write_rds
title: Write an R rds file — write_rds
text: Wrapper around readr::write_rds(), maximum 'xz' compression default, also corrects file permissions writeable group, often issue PHS RStudio server.

title: Write an R rds file — write_rds
Write an R rds file — write_rds
text: data R object write serialise. path Path data written. compress Compression method use: "none", "gz" ,"bz", "xz". ... Additional arguments write_rds() subsequent connection function. example, control space-time trade-different compression methods compression. See connections() details.

title: Write an R rds file — write_rds
text: write_sav() returns input data invisibly.

what: Write an SPSS zsav file — write_sav
title: Write an SPSS zsav file — write_sav
text: Wrapper around haven::write_sav() compression default, also corrects file permissions writeable group, often issue PHS RStudio server.

title: Write an SPSS zsav file — write_sav
Write an SPSS zsav file — write_sav
text: data tibble write. path Path data written. compress Compression type use: "byte": uses byte compression (default SPSS). "none": compression. useful software issues byte compressed .sav files (e.g. SAS). "zsav": default, uses zlib compression produces .zsav file. zlib compression supported SPSS version 21.0 . TRUE FALSE can used backwards compatibility, correspond "zsav" "none" options respectively.

title: Write an SPSS zsav file — write_sav
text: write_sav() returns input data invisibly.
